result.description: D3.4 provides the final release of the Big Data pipeline definition integrated in the simulation tool and thecontainer-based template definition, as well as the deployment and orchestration components of the DataCloudtoolbox used in the final business case versions.

result.title: Blockchain-based decentralized marketplace v1
result.description: D4.2 describes the initial decentralized resources marketplace for the Cloud Computing Continuum, implementingthe governance rules defined in Task 1.3, market mechanisms and resource reservation. The release will alsocontain interfaces with the pipelines definition (WP3), the provisioning (WP5) and the frontend tools (T4.3).

result.title: Blockchain-based decentralized marketplace v2
result.description: D4.4 describes the final release of the decentralized resources marketplace for Computing Continuum, including improved interfaces based on the feedback from other work packages and tasks. In addition, it will feature smart contracts and oracles for collecting hardware and performance metrics, and validating SLAs on the blockchain.

result.description: D2.2 presents the set of analytics and visualization techniques implemented in the DataCloud toolbox to obtainadvanced diagnostics of the discovered Big Data pipelines.

result.title: Monitoring and resource behaviour analysis
result.description: D5.4 depicts the resource monitoring architecture with specific tools for performance analysis of the provisioned resources registered in the resource marketplace. result.title: Event-detection and infrastructure and deployment adaptation
result.description: D5.3 describes the explored ML algorithms for event detection during pipeline execution. Furthermore, it describes the infrastructure adaptation based on the identified events, such as reduced performance or insufficient resources.

result.title: Integrated marketplace frontend
result.description: D4.5 describes the unified frontend that integrates the applications and appliances repository with the decentralized marketplace. The release will feature a web portal similar to public Cloud services, where platform users perform common operations such as resources monitoring, revenue monitoring and Big Data pipeline progress.
